body_html:
@mrry ， yes, I do it like this:

image = tf.reshape(image, tf.pack([height, width, channel]))

where height, width and channel are tensors, but it turns out that:
All shapes must be fully defined: [TensorShape([Dimension(None), Dimension(None), Dimension(None)]), TensorShape([Dimension(512), Dimension(512)]), TensorShape([Dimension(3)])]
in the line of tf.train.shuffle_batch() call

I have no idea about it.

body:
@mrry ， yes, I do it like this: 

``` python
image = tf.reshape(image, tf.pack([height, width, channel]))
```

where height, width and channel are tensors, but it turns out that:
`All shapes must be fully defined: [TensorShape([Dimension(None), Dimension(None), Dimension(None)]), TensorShape([Dimension(512), Dimension(512)]), TensorShape([Dimension(3)])]`
in the line of `tf.train.shuffle_batch()` call

 I have no idea about it.
